text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 33_Paragrap: and of the rain to fall.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 34_Paragrap: <small>If you neglected to say this, see page 000.</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 35_Paragrap: Sustainer of the living with kindliness,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 36_Paragrap: Resurrector of the dead with great mercy,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 41_Paragrap: to those who sleep in the dust.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 42_Paragrap: Who is like You, Master of mighty deeds,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 43_Paragrap: and who can be compared to You?
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 44_Paragrap: King Who causes death and restores life,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 45_Paragrap: and causes deliverance to sprout forth.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 46_Paragrap: <small>(During the Ten Days of Penitence add:</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 47_Paragrap: Who is like You merciful Father,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 48_Paragrap: Who remembers His creatures for life,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 50_Paragrap: <small>If you forgot to say this, see page 000.</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 52_Paragrap: to restore the dead to life.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 56_Paragrap: You are holy and Your Name is holy
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 59_Paragrap: For a great and Almighty King—
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 61_Paragrap: <small>During the Ten Days of Penitence, continue at the asterisk (*) below</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 67_Paragrap: <small>If you mistakenly said, “the Almighty” instead of “the King,” or if you are in doubt, see page 000.</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 72_Paragrap: [with the ability] to know Your Torah
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 75_Paragrap: You made a distinction, Adonoy, our God,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 87_Paragrap: and devoted to the fear of You.)
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 93_Paragrap: Cause us to return, our Father,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 95_Paragrap: and bring us near, our King, to Your service;
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 101_Paragra: Pardon us, our Father, for we have sinned,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 104_Paragra: for you are a good and forgiving almighty.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 112_Paragra: for the sake of Your Name;
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 113_Paragra: because You are a Mighty Redeemer.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 116_Paragra: <small>(On Fast Days, the Chazzan says “Answer us” which is on page 000 and concludes, “Blessed are . . . Who responds at times of trouble.”)</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 118_Paragra: Heal us, Adonoy, and we will be healed,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 119_Paragra: deliver us and we will be delivered;
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 125_Paragra: because You are the Almighty, King,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 126_Paragra: Who is a faithful and merciful Healer.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 128_Paragra: Healer of the sick of His people Israel.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 130_Paragra: Bless for us, Adonoy our God,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 132_Paragra: and all the varieties of its produce
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 135_Paragra: From the first day of Pesach until the evening service [Maariv] on December 4, or, on a civil leap year, December 5, we say the following line.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 137_Paragra: From the evening service [Maariv] on December 4, or, on a civil leap year, December 5, until the First day of Pesach, we say the following line.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 138_Paragra: dew and rain for a blessing
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 139_Paragra: <small>If you forgot to say this, see page 000.</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 140_Paragra: upon the face of the earth;
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 143_Paragra: as other good years, for blessing,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 150_Paragra: Sound the great shofar for our liberty,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 151_Paragra: and raise a banner to gather our exiles,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 153_Paragra: from the four corners of the earth.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 157_Paragra: of the dispersed of His people Israel.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 160_Paragra: and our counselors as at first.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 161_Paragra: Remove from us sorrow and sighing,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 167_Paragra: <small>During the Ten Days of Penitence, continue at the asterisk (*) below</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 169_Paragra: King, Lover of righteousness and justice.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 173_Paragra: <small>If you mistakenly said, “King, Lover of righteousness and justice,” instead of “the King of Justice,” see page 000.</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 175_Paragra: For informers let there be no hope
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 176_Paragra: and may all wickedness instantly perish
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 177_Paragra: may all Your enemies be swiftly cut off,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 179_Paragra: may You quickly uproot, crush, rout,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 181_Paragra: and subdue speedily in our days.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 186_Paragra: Upon the righteous, upon the pious,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 187_Paragra: upon the elders of the remnant of Your people
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 189_Paragra: upon the remnant of their scholars,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 190_Paragra: upon the true proselytes, and upon us,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 194_Paragra: to all who trust in Your Name in truth;
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 195_Paragra: and place our lot among them,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 196_Paragra: and may we never be put to shame,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 197_Paragra: for in You we have put our trust,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 201_Paragra: Support and Trust of the righteous.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 205_Paragra: and dwell therein as You have spoken;
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 206_Paragra: and rebuild it soon, in our days,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 208_Paragra: and the throne of David, Your servant
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 213_Paragra: The sprout of David, Your servant,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 215_Paragra: and exalt his power with Your deliverance,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 216_Paragra: For Your deliverance we hope all day.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 223_Paragra: Hear our voice, Adonoy, our God;
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 224_Paragra: spare us and have compassion on us,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 229_Paragra: and from Your Presence, our King,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 230_Paragra: do not turn us away empty-handed,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 233_Paragra: for You hear the prayers of every mouth
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 234_Paragra: of Your people, Israel, with compassion.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 240_Paragra: and pay heed to their prayer;
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 242_Paragra: to the Holy of Holies in Your abode,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 246_Paragra: And may You always find pleasure
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 247_Paragra: with the service of Your people, Israel.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 248_Paragra: <small>On regular weekdays continue, “And may our eyes,” on p. 000.</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 249_Paragra: <small>On Rosh Chodesh and on Chol HaMoed, the following prayer is added:</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 250_Paragra: Our God and God of our fathers,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 251_Paragra: may there ascend, come, and reach,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 257_Paragra: the son of David, Your servant;
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 260_Paragra: and the remembrance of Your entire people,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 261_Paragra: the House of Israel, before You
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 271_Paragra: be mindful of us on this day for blessing,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 272_Paragra: and deliver us for good life.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 273_Paragra: In accord with the promise of deliverance
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 276_Paragra: have compassion on us and deliver us;
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 277_Paragra: for to You our eyes are directed
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 279_Paragra: Who is King, Gracious, and Merciful.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 280_Paragra: <small>If you forgot to say this, see page 000.</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 284_Paragra: Who returns His Divine Presence to Zion.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 285_Paragra: At the words, We are thankful, bend forward; at Adonoy return to an upright position.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 288_Paragra: that You Adonoy are our God
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 289_Paragra: and the God of our fathers forever;
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 290_Paragra: our Rock, Rock of our lives,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 293_Paragra: We will give thanks to You
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 296_Paragra: which are committed into Your hand,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 299_Paragra: and for Your miracles of every day with us,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 300_Paragra: and for Your wonders and benefactions
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 304_Paragra: for Your compassion is never withheld;
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 307_Paragra: for we have always placed our hope in You.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 308_Paragra: <small>(On Chanukah and Purim the following prayer is added. If you omitted it, you need not repeat the Shemoneh Esrei. If, however, you became aware of your omission before concluding the blessing, you should say it at that time, and conclude by saying, “ וְעַל כֻּלָּם , and for all the foregoing.”)</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 310_Paragra: for the redemption, for the mighty deeds,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 311_Paragra: for the deliverances, for the wonders
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 312_Paragra: for the consolations and for the wars
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 313_Paragra: that You performed for our fathers
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 314_Paragra: in those days at this season.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 317_Paragra: son of Yochanan the High Priest,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 319_Paragra: when the evil Greek kingdom rose up
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 321_Paragra: to make them forget Your Torah
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 323_Paragra: from the statutes of Your will—
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 325_Paragra: stood by them in their time of distress,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 330_Paragra: into the hands of the weak,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 331_Paragra: many into the hands of the few,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 332_Paragra: defiled people into the hands of the undefiled,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 333_Paragra: the wicked into the hands of the righteous,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 334_Paragra: and insolent [sinners] into the hands of
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 337_Paragra: a great and sanctified name in Your world.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 340_Paragra: and redemption unto this very day.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 342_Paragra: the Holy of Holies of Your Abode,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 346_Paragra: in the Courtyards of Your Sanctuary,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 347_Paragra: and designated these eight days of Chanukah
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 348_Paragra: to thank and praise Your great Name.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 350_Paragra: In the days of Mordechai and Esther
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 352_Paragra: when the evil Haman rose up against them,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 353_Paragra: he sought to destroy, to kill,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 354_Paragra: and to annihilate all the Jews,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 355_Paragra: young and old, infants and women,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 356_Paragra: in one day, the thirteenth day
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 358_Paragra: which is the month of Adar,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 360_Paragra: And You, in Your abundant mercy,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 363_Paragra: and brought his evil plan upon his own head,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 364_Paragra: and they hanged him and his sons
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 370_Paragra: <small>During the Ten Days of Penitence, add:</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 372_Paragra: all the children of Your covenant.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 373_Paragra: <small>If you forgot to say this, see page 000.</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 374_Paragra: And all the living shall thank You forever
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 376_Paragra: Your great Name with sincerity forever;
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 378_Paragra: the Almighty, Who is our deliverance
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 383_Paragra: and You it is fitting to praise.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 387_Paragra: upon us and upon all Israel, Your people.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 388_Paragra: Bless us, our Father, all of us as one
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 389_Paragra: with the light of Your countenance.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 390_Paragra: For by the light of Your countenance
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 391_Paragra: You gave us Adonoy our God,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 392_Paragra: a Torah of life and the love of kindliness,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 395_Paragra: And may it be good in Your sight
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 397_Paragra: and to bless Your people Israel,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 398_Paragra: at all times and at every moment
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 401_Paragra: <small>During the Ten Days of Penitence continue here:</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 402_Paragra: In the book of life, blessing, peace
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 405_Paragra: may we be remembered and inscribed
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 407_Paragra: we and all Your people, the House of Israel
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 408_Paragra: for a good life and peace.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 409_Paragra: <small>If you forget to say this you need not go back and repeat it.</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 413_Paragra: <small> The following is said by some in place of  שים שלום  on the previous page.</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 418_Paragra: are the Master of all peace.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 419_Paragra: And may it be good in Your sight
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 421_Paragra: and to bless Your people Israel,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 422_Paragra: at all times and at every moment
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 424_Paragra: <small>During the Ten Days of Penitence continue here:</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 425_Paragra: In the book of life, blessing, peace
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 428_Paragra: may we be remembered and inscribed
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 430_Paragra: we and all Your people, the House of Israel
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 431_Paragra: for a good life and peace.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 432_Paragra: <small>If you forget to say this you need not go back and repeat it.</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 438_Paragra: and the thoughts of my heart, before You
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 439_Paragra: Adonoy, my Rock and my Redeemer.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 440_Paragra: My God, guard my tongue from evil
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 441_Paragra: and my lips from speaking deceitfully.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 444_Paragra: and let my soul be like dust to all.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 445_Paragra: Open my heart to Your Torah
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 446_Paragra: and let my soul pursue Your commandments.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 447_Paragra: And all who plan evil against me,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 451_Paragra: Adonoy, my God and God of my fathers,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 452_Paragra: that no person be envious of me
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 453_Paragra: and that I not be envious of others,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 454_Paragra: that I not be brought to anger this day,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 455_Paragra: and that I not cause Your anger;
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 456_Paragra: and save me from the evil inclination,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 457_Paragra: and help me be humble and any modest.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 459_Paragra: unify Your Name in Your world,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 460_Paragra: rebuild Your city, establish Your house
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 463_Paragra: redeem Your people, rejoice Your congregation).
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 464_Paragra: Act for the sake of Your Name.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 465_Paragra: Act for the sake of Your right hand.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 466_Paragra: Act for the sake of Your Torah.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 467_Paragra: Act for the sake of Your holiness.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 468_Paragra: In order that Your loved ones be released,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 469_Paragra: deliver [with] Your right hand and answer me.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 470_Paragra: <small>Biblical phrases applicable to one's name may be found on pp. 000-000.</small>
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 473_Paragra: and the thoughts of my heart—before You
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 474_Paragra: Adonoy, my Rock and my Redeemer.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 478_Paragra: upon us and upon all Israel
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 481_Paragra: Adonoy, our God, and the God of our Fathers
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 482_Paragra: that the Holy Temple be rebuilt
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 484_Paragra: and grant us our share in Your Torah.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 485_Paragra: And there we will serve You reverently
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 486_Paragra: as in the days of old,
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 489_Paragra: with the offerings of Judah and Jerusalem
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 490_Paragra: as in the days of old and in earlier years.
text.14_Maariv, 3_Shemoneh Esrei, 491_Paragra: <small>The Chazzan recites the half Kaddish, and the congregation then says, “May the pleasantness” and “and You Holy One,” found on p. 000.</small>
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 0_P: <small>At the conclusion of the Festivals, and on a Saturday night before a Festival, say  עָלֵינוּ.</small>
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 1_P: Exalted and sanctified be His great Name
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 2_P: in the world which He created
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 4_P: and may He rule His kingdom
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 6_P: and hasten the coming of His Mashiach.
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 7_P: In your lifetime and in your days,
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 9_P: of the entire House of Israel,
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 10_: speedily and in the near future—
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 12_: May His great Name be blessed
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 17_: be the Name of the Holy One, blessed is He;
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 18_: above (Ten Days of Penitence: far above)
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 21_: which we utter in the world—and say Amein.
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 22_: May the pleasantness of my Master our God
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 24_: and the work of our hands established for us,
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 25_: and the work of our hands—establish it.
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 27_: in the shelter of the Supreme One,
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 28_: under the protection of Shadai he will abide.
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 30_: [He is] my refuge and my stronghold,
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 31_: my God in Whom I trust.
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 32_: For He will save you from the snare-trap,
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 34_: With His wings He will cover you
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 35_: and beneath His wings, you will find refuge;
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 36_: His truth is a shield, a full shield.
text.14_Maariv, 4_Motzei Shabbos Prayers, 37_: You will not fear the terror of night,

text.15_Counting the Omer, 0_Paragraph: <small>The Omer is counted from the second night of Pesach until the night before Shavuos. The counting of forty-nine days (seven weeks) between the Festival of Pesach and Shavuos (the Feast of Weeks), connects the exodus from Egypt with the festival of the giving of the Torah. Just as one who awaits a most intimate friend on a certain day counts the days in eager anticipation of his arrival, so do we count the days from our liberation till the day we receive the Torah, which is the culmination and fulfillment of our freedom.</small>

text.18_Hallel, 0_Paragraph: Hallel, the name especially applied to Psalms 113-118, is mentioned in the Talmud (Pesachim 117a), when Rabbi Judah quoted Samuel as saying “Who recited this Hallel? (Who ordained that this Hallel be read?) The prophets ordained that Israel should recite Hallel when they are redeemed from misfortune as an expression of gratitude for their redemption.”
text.18_Hallel, 1_Paragraph: In time, the Rabbis made the reading of Hallel obligatory on the major festivals such as Pesach, Shavuos, and Sukkos. Since Maccabean times, Chanukah is like- wise marked by the reading of Hallel. On Purim the reading of the Scroll of Esther takes the place of Hallel. (Maseches Megillah 14a)
text.18_Hallel, 2_Paragraph: The reading of Hallel on Rosh Chodesh is not rabbinically ordained, but a minhag, a custom which began with the Jews of Babylon in the second century, and has been accepted by all Israel as an obligatory Service. Because it is a minor festival, the Hallel is shortened on Rosh Chodesh by omitting half of Psalms 115 and 116. On the last six days of Pesach also, only “half”-Hallel is recited to show that our joy is diminished because of the drowning of the Egyptians.
text.18_Hallel, 3_Paragraph: Hallel is omitted in a house of mourning (during the week of shiv'ah) on Rosh Chodesh and Chanukah.

text.19_Musaf for Rosh Chodesh, 91_Paragraph: [as] a time of atonement1Rosh Chodesh is designated as “a time of atonement,” a reminder of its solemn aspect which should be deeply stressed. In Judaism all beginnings are holy, and the beginning of the month calls forth serious reflections regarding sins committed during the previous month. This concept was crystallized by Rabbi Moshe Cordovero of Safed, who inaugurated the practice of fasting on the day before Rosh Chodesh (except at the end of Nisan, Elul, Tishrei and Kislev) as Yom Kippur Koton, a minor day of atonement.

text.22_Chanukah Service, 0_Paragraph: The festival of Chanukah begins on the 25th day of Kislev and lasts eight days. The Chanukah lights should be kindled as soon as possible after nightfall. On Friday the Chanukah lights are kindled before the Sabbath candles are lit. On the first night of Chanukah, one light is kindled—at the right of the menorah. Each night thereafter one light is added—to the immediate left of the one kindled the preceding night. The newly-added light is always kindled first, and the kindling then proceeds toward the right.
